alert.note: Alert for Lucas; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 6:08AM EDT until August 24 at 9:15AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following counties, in north central Ohio, Crawford and Erie. In northwest Ohio, Lucas, Ottawa, Sandusky, Seneca and Wyandot. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 608 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tiffin, Fremont, Fostoria, Bucyrus, Upper Sandusky, Port Clinton, Kelleys Island, Put-In-Bay, Oregon, Galion, Bellevue, Clyde, Crestline, Oak Harbor, Gibsonburg, Genoa, Woodville, Elmore, Green Springs and New Washington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
